availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tennis W. Wade (Covington, Kentucky, painter apprentice and soldier. )

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, painter apprentice and soldier. Son of William W. Wade and Eliza Lennis Wade. Painter apprentice in Covington in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, sergeant, and second lieutenant from October 3, 1862 to July 17, 1865

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 3, p. 626.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0113.
"Tennis W. Wade Dead," The Kentucky Post (Covington, KY), Jan 01, 1912, p. 5.
